article.headline: Lockheed Martin's stock rallies after profit and sales beat, raised outlook
article.body: Shares of Lockheed Martin Corp. LMT, -0.68% rallied 3.7% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the aerospace and defense company reported second-quarter profit and sales that rose above expectations, and lifted its full-year outlook. Net income rose to $1.63 billion, or $5.79 a share, from $1.42 billion, or $5.00 a share, in the year ago period. The FactSet consensus for earnings per share was $5.72. Sales rose 12.4% to $16.22 billion, well above the FactSet consensus of $15.23 billion, as each of the companies business segments saw sales rise above expectations. For 2020, Lockheed raised its guidance ranges for EPS to $23.75 to $24.05 from $23.65 to $23.95 and for sales to $63.50 billion to $65.00 billion from $62.25 billion to $64.00 billion. The company said the 2020 financial outlook remain uncertain as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and current assumptions assume production facilities don't experience significant work stoppages and closures. The stock has slipped 6.1% year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has edged up 0.7%.
